page.title: 01LOXTON RIVER AXE
page.content: THE MENDIP SLOPES,WITH THE LOXTON GAP AND THE ATTENDANT M5,DOMINATES THIS AREA.WITH LOXTON HILL TO THE WEST AND CROOK'S PEAK TO THE EAST.THE DRIVER TRAVELLING SOUTH ON THE M5 HAS MAGNIFICENT VIEWS AROUND HIM AND BEFORE HIM. HERE THE MENDIP HILLS ARE NOT SCARREDBY NEW QUARRYING AND OLD WORKINGS HAVE FADED INTO THE HILLS.LOXTON,UNUSAL IN ITS FORM,CAUSES THE TRAVELLER TO CONSIDER EXPLORING WHILE COMTON BISHOP ENTICES THE TRAVELLER INTO MENDIPS EMBRACE. THE RIVER AXE,ON ITS WESTWARD COURSE FROM WOOKEY HOLE,IS JOINED BY THE LOX YEO RIVER FLOWING SOUTH FROM WINSCOMBE AND FROM THE SOUTH.THE OLD RIVER AXE,AT ONE TIME THE THE MAIN ARTERY TO THE ABBEY AT GLASTONBURY. THE LAND HERE IS WELL DRAINED AND USED MAINLY FOR CATTLE.
